Class ClientHandler

java.lang.Object
java.rmi.server.RemoteObject
java.rmi.server.RemoteServer
java.rmi.server.UnicastRemoteObject
it.polimi.it.galaxytrucker.networking.server.ClientHandler
All Implemented Interfaces:
Listener, Serializable, Remote
Direct Known Subclasses:
RMIClientHandler, SocketClientHandler
public abstract class ClientHandler extends UnicastRemoteObject implements Listener
Handles communication and interactions for a single connected client on the server side. This class acts as an intermediary between the core server logic (ServerInterface) and a specific client, managing message queues, handling both RMI and Socket communication, and processing client input. It implements Listener to receive updates from the game model and RMIVirtualServer to expose remote methods callable by RMI clients.
Version:
2.0
Author:
giacomoamaducci

  • Method Details

    • setController

      public void setController(ControllerInterface controller)
      Sets the game controller associated with this client handler. The controller manages the specific game instance the client is participating in. This method ensures the controller is set only once.
      Parameters:
      controller - The ControllerInterface instance for the client's game.

    • getUsername

      public String getUsername()
      Gets the username of the client associated with this handler.
      Returns:
      The client's username.

    • getUuid

      public UUID getUuid()
      Gets the UUID of the client associated with this handler.
      Returns:
      The client's UUID.

    • notify

      public void notify(GameUpdate update)
      Receives a game update from the model and adds it to the queue for sending to the client. This method implements the Listener.notify(GameUpdate) interface method. It ensures the update is added to the queue, retrying if necessary.
      Specified by:
      notify in interface Listener
      Parameters:
      update - The GameUpdate object received from the model.

    • run

      public abstract void run()
      Starts the communication threads for the client handler. This method launches a thread to continuously take messages from the updatesForClientQueue and send them to the client using the appropriate communication method (RMI or Socket). If the communication type is SOCKET, it also starts a separate thread to read incoming messages from the socket input stream and process them as UserInput.

    • processUserInput

      public void processUserInput(Message message) throws RemoteException

      RemoteException
